me.aliceq.heatmap

Class HeatMapAnalysis

  • java.lang.Object
    • me.aliceq.heatmap.HeatMapAnalysis

  • public abstract class HeatMapAnalysis
extends java.lang.Object
    An abstract class offering methods for combining and creating HeatMap data

    • Method Detail

      • lerp

        public static final <K extends java.lang.Comparable> HeatMap<K> lerp(HeatMap<K> a,
                                               HeatMap<K> b,
                                               float value)
        Finds the linear interpolation of a set of maps. If a key is contained in one key but not in another, it is simply treated as a value of 0 where it doesn't exist
        Type Parameters:
        K - the type of key
        Parameters:
        a - the first HeatMap
        b - the second HeatMap
        value - a value from 0 to 1 (inclusive). A value <= 0 returns HeatMap a, a value >= 1 returns HeatMap b and a value of 0.5 returns a perfect average.
        Returns:
        a new HeatMap instance whose keys and values are the result of the calculation

      • average

        public static final <K extends java.lang.Comparable> HeatMap<K> average(HeatMap<K> a,
                                                  HeatMap<K> b)
        Finds the average of a set of maps. If a key is contained in one key but not in another, it is simply treated as a value of 0 where it doesn't exist. This is the same as calling lerp(a, b, 0.5f)
        Type Parameters:
        K - the type of key
        Parameters:
        a - the first HeatMap
        b - the second HeatMap
        Returns:
        a new HeatMap instance whose keys and values are the result of the calculation

      • average

        public static final <K extends java.lang.Comparable> HeatMap<K> average(HeatMap<K>[] maps)
        Finds the average of a set of maps. If a key is contained in one key but not in another, it is simply treated as a value of 0 where it doesn't exist. Similarly, a null map will be treated as zeroes;
        Type Parameters:
        K - the type of key
        Parameters:
        maps - HeatMaps to average
        Returns:
        a new HeatMap instance whose keys and values are the result of the calculation

      • powerSeries

        public static final <K extends java.lang.Comparable> HeatMap<K> powerSeries(HeatMap<K>[] maps,
                                                      float k)
        Returns the power series of a set of maps. That is:
        result = a[0]k + a[1]k^2 + a[2]k^3 + a[3]k^4 + ... + a[n]k^n

        In addition, the end result is divided by (k + k^2 + k^3 + ... + k^n) to attempt to preserve normalization. Similarly, a null map will be treated as zeroes;

        Type Parameters:
        K - the type of key
        Parameters:
        maps - HeatMaps in the series from 0 to n
        k - k value. This should be between 0 and 1.
        Returns:
        a new HeatMap instance whose keys and values are the result of the calculation

      • trim

        public static final <K extends java.lang.Comparable> HeatMap<K> trim(HeatMap<K> map,
                                               float thresh)
        Returns a trimmed version of the HeatMap where any values lower than the threshold are removed.
        Type Parameters:
        K - the type of key
        Parameters:
        map - the source map
        thresh - threshold to trim. Any value lower than this will be removed.
        Returns:
        a new HeatMap instance whose keys and values are the result of the calculation

      • trimUpper

        public static final <K extends java.lang.Comparable> HeatMap<K> trimUpper(HeatMap<K> map,
                                                    float thresh)
        Returns a trimmed version of the HeatMap where any values higher than the threshold are removed.
        Type Parameters:
        K - the type of key
        Parameters:
        map - the source map
        thresh - threshold to trim. Any value higher than this will be removed.
        Returns:
        a new HeatMap instance whose keys and values are the result of the calculation

      • getCumulative

        public static final <K extends java.lang.Comparable> HeatMapDataSet<K> getCumulative(HeatMap<K> map)
        Returns the cumulative form of a HeatMap. That is, each key is sorted by rank with its value equal to the cumulative sum of the keys before it. The final element in the series equals the source map's total sum.
        Type Parameters:
        K - the type of key
        Parameters:
        map - the source map
        Returns:
        a new HeatMap instance whose keys and values are the result of the calculation

      • getCDF

        public static final <K extends java.lang.Comparable> HeatMapDataSet<K> getCDF(HeatMap<K> map)
        Returns the cumulative distribution function of a normalized HeatMap. This is similar to calling getCumulative after verifying normalization.
        Type Parameters:
        K - the type of key
        Parameters:
        map - the source map
        Returns:
        a new HeatMap instance whose keys and values are the result of the calculation

      • randomFromCDF

        public static <K extends java.lang.Comparable> K randomFromCDF(HeatMap<K> map)
        Returns a random key from the provided HeatMap based on its distribution. If there are no elements in the map, a null value is returned.
        Type Parameters:
        K - the type of key
        Parameters:
        map - the source map
        Returns:
        a random key with probability [value] from the map

      • randomKey

        public static <K extends java.lang.Comparable> K randomKey(HeatMap<K> map)
        Returns a random key from the provided map with equal probability for all. If there are no elements in the map, a null value is returned.
        Type Parameters:
        K - the type of key
        Parameters:
        map - the source map
        Returns:
        a random key from the map
